title: Windows 7 SP1 Ultimate x64 Low Memory Rollup Update April 2016
description:
Windows 7 had major memory leak in svchost after SP1 which caused it to slow down to unusability after working for some time on machines with 2GB memory or less ... Microsoft finally fixed this in non-critical update KB3102810 in April 2015, but Windows 7 won't work ok until you get this update installed after some time (if you let it update automatically).

What's included:

- Windows 7 Ultimate x64
- Service Pack 1 (and prerequisites)
- KB3102810 - Installing and searching for updates is slow and high CPU usage occurs
- KB3125574 - Convenience rollup update for Windows 7 SP1 (and prerequisites)
- KB3172605 - July 2016 update rollup for Windows 7 SP1
- Removewat tool


Installation instructions:

It installs automatically without the key, just reset it after the installation to activate update KB3102810 and avoid the slowing down of Windows.
Removewat tool for activation is included in image, just use it. If you let Windows update automatically and get the message that your copy of windows is not genuine after some update, just start the Removewat again, deinstall it and install it again (you have to do this only once...)

Wish you all fast Windows 7 on computers with low memory
